articles.title: 20000-foot-tall mountain on the moon named in honor of trailblazing computer scientist Melba Roy Mouton - Livescience.com
articles.description: Mons Mouton, a mountain near the moon's south pole, has been officially named after Melba Roy Mouton, a pioneering NASA computer programmer and mathematician in the 1960s and '70s.
articles.content:
The International Astronomical Union (IAU) has named a 20,000-foot-tall (6,000 meters) mountain on the moon
 in honor of pioneering American mathematician Melba Roy Mouton.
